[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/exp/281/Headlines.png[/img][/align]

[color=#FFFFFF][b]Private Data has been Removed from the Orders Database[/b][/color]
On February 20th, 2016 [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] officially removed the stored private data of members from the Orders Database. With the option of upgrading and/or paying with PayPal having been recently removed [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] decided to remove nine columns from the Orders Table. Those nine being; First Names // Last Names // Emails // Addresses // Cities // States // Zip Codes // Countries // Phone Numbers. These columns have been completely removed so that even on previous orders there is no stored information. If you would like to read [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient's[/b][/color][/url] thread on the matter you may do so, [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5177902]here[/url].

[color=#FFFFFF][b]Trust Scan Updates[/b][/color]
On February 22nd, 2016 [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] made it so that all members are now able to use the Trust Scan feature, even those who have zero posts. Also with that on our Trust Scan page is a new line for 'Last Gauth/2FA Validation'. Meaning, when members click on their 'Test Code' option on the Gauth page it will change the last date on that new line, the same as it would on the 'Gauth Activation Date' line located above. Primarily this will hopefully help members realize who actually has access to the 2FA of that account and who doesn't. All members have to do is ask the person on the other end of the transaction to simply click the 'Test Code' button and that way they'll have a much better idea of whether or not they're truly dealing with the owner of that account. With that, the later the date is of the activation and if the last validation date has a recent change date then there is a much higher chance that you are actually dealing with the real account owner. If you would like to read [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient's[/b][/color][/url] announcement simply make your way to this thread, [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5180331]here[/url].

[align=left][size=x-small][color=white][b]*[/b][/color] - As of the Friday prior to release.[/size][/align]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/exp/281/NotableThreads.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white][u]Announcement Threads[/u][/color][/b]

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5178401][b]Thread Sort Order[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Omnsicient has decided to sort threads in the deal dispute based on the date they were created from now on. Recently created threads will always be on top as opposed to other sections, where threads with the most recent replies are placed the highest.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5180331][b]Trust Scan Changes[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Omniscient has made the Trust Scan feature available to all members. From now on you don't have to be upgraded to use the feature. You can also check if your 2FA Gauth code is working correctly by visiting [url=http://hackforums.net/gauth.php]this[/url] link from now on.

[b][color=white][u]Informational Threads[/u][/color][/b]

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5155141][b]Free Educational Ebooks[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=355706][color=#00AAFF][b]Saiyuki[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]The user Saiyuki has provided us with a web page where you can find various eBooks that will be helpful if you're interested in programming, computing or hacking. Take a look at his thread if you want to know more!

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5181590][b]Cin's Favorite "Techniques" 3/4[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1221196][color=#EFEFEF][b]King Cin[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]King Cin has created a thread where he talks about a concept called "Push Pull" within the seduction community. Take a look at this thread if you're interested in human relationships and attraction in general.

[b][color=white][u]Entertaining Threads[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5163617][b]If you could eliminate one whole Group. Who would it be?[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2719306][color=#EFEFEF][b]Romantic[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Romantic asks the community which subculture they'd want to get rid off the most. If you're in for a fun discussion or like to read ridiculous replies, check this thread out!

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5186354][b]I have the best UID[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=187420][color=#00AAFF][b]iDuL[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]iDul thought it was an interesting idea to share his UID with us. The thread quickly turned into a discussion about what the numbers on your UID might mean.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5184438][b]Anyone else got a none techy girlfriend?[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3048796][color=#EFEFEF][b]LeOptimal[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]You probably don't have a girlfriend, but if you do have one post on this thread. Here the community talks about whether their girlfriends are into technology or not.

[b][color=white][u]Contests and Giveaways[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5180050][b]$1000 USA Amazon Giftcard[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2292899][color=#EFEFEF][b]Divined[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Divined is giving away an Amazon gift card worth $1000. The thread is rather vague, but all you have to do to be eligible for the code is posting on the thread.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5180995][b]$2,400 BTC Giveaway! [WEEKLY][/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2967793][color=#EFEFEF][b]Spectral Wolf[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]The member Spectral Wolf is giving away $50 every week to prove he wouldn't "scam for a measly $1000." If you like money you should enter this contest. 

[b][color=white][u]Member Feedback Threads[/u][/color][/b]

No feedback threads were made this week. You're either all lazy or are working on one. 

[b][color=white][u]Miscellaneous[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5179204][b]I sat in a puddle of piss[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=276957][color=#00AAFF][b]Misty[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Misty shares a pretty gross story with us. I won't spoil the details for you, but you wouldn't want to be in this member's shoes. Let's just hope it doesn't happen again.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5185461][b]G-Eazy - Order More ft. Starrah[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2772052][color=#99FF00][b]Demonic Form[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]The rapper G-Eazy recently released a music video for his song "Order More" and Demonic Form is stoked about it. If you're looking for new music, try listening to Order More by G-Eazy & Starrah.

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/exp/281/Interview.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2825754][color=#98FB98][b]CyberGuard[/b][/color][/url][/font][/size][spoiler=][align=left]

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada:[/b][/color][/url] Hello and welcome to the HF News.
Before we start is there any shout outs you would like to make?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2825754][color=#98FB98][b]CyberGuard:[/b][/color][/url] Hey, thanks for taking this time to interview me. I want to give a shout out to all my cryptographic enthusiasts. Of course I can't forget to shout out my guys: True Demon, Repentance and you Armada, love you guys a lot!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada:[/b][/color][/url] Very nice, it was True Demon who recommended you for the interview.
So to start, tell us a bit about yourself, what brings you to HF?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2825754][color=#98FB98][b]CyberGuard:[/b][/color][/url] Yeah. That question isn't too hard to answer. The main reason is because HF is the biggest gathering spot for everyone interested in things related to hacking. Be that white or black hat.
I'm always looking for promising new people willing to learn more, and HF is the perfect place for that. As we all know: Knowledge is Power.
Besides, from time to time you meet new people who have a lot of experience and can even teach you a few new things.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada:[/b][/color][/url] Very true, Hack Forums does boast oneof the largest IT security and Hacking communities around.
That being said, I noticed your 2 top posted in forums are Beginning Hacking and the Hash section.  Which say the least is a bit of a jump between areas, why such heavy activity between those two sections?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2825754][color=#98FB98][b]CyberGuard:[/b][/color][/url] I think the first one is quite obvious considering what I've previously said. I am always looking for promising people, of course I don't just limit to that. I always try to help out some of the beginners having issues with the simple things. After all, it's the beginner hacking section where the beginners start to post. It's of course not uncommon to have 100s of the same types of threads a day asking the same question :).

As for the cryptography section. I really enjoy hash cracking and have always liked the idea of having your own little "language". I crack hashes for people not being able to do it themselves and try to help them out with that. To help those wanting to do this themselves I've made a small (unofficial) group for hash cracking enthusiasts wanting to learn more and currently have a free to use hash database lookup program so people don't have to post but can look stuff up there first.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada:[/b][/color][/url] We all have to learn some how, its nice to see more experienced members offering a helping hand.  What advice would you give to a new guy wanting to break into Hacking and Network (in)Security?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2825754][color=#98FB98][b]CyberGuard:[/b][/color][/url] Besides reading a few books (like True Demon's ebook or Mad76's wifi hacking book) and informative threads (like some of the FAQ and Mega threads) you can learn a lot from being active in the beginner hacking section.
If you click every single thread in the first 2 pages (CTRL+Click) and you try to google or find an answer to that question, you learn a lot in a short time.
Try and write a response of at least 100 words that describes exactly what you found (if you found an answer to their question).
I used to do this myself on both this and other forums and noticed myself learning a lot of new stuff.
At some point you'll get bored of answering the same questions over and over again, so you can look for questions that are more difficult. Before you know it you'll have learned more than you ever thought you could.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada:[/b][/color][/url] Very good advice, and a great way to not only learn but contribute back.  Drawing from many of your older posts, you seem to had taken a more direct interest in Hash cracking rather than other specialized areas, what is it with Hash cracking that drew you to it as opposed to other areas?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2825754][color=#98FB98][b]CyberGuard:[/b][/color][/url] Well, I used to and still am very interested in penetration testing and ethical hacking, but that is something I don't spend much time on on HF, no particular reason for that. But hash cracking itself is just a small part of that as well.
I believe many people underestimate hash cracking (or cryptography) and hope that what I (and others) do make people direct more of their attention to cryptography in general rather than just "hacking". I believe people will eventually understand that even if you hack something, you still can't do anything if you don't know what to do with the hashes you obtain. 
It's not about leaking something in ethical hacking, it's about gaining and maintaining access.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada:[/b][/color][/url] I understand yourself and a few members have been working on what could arguably be one of the largest hashed database system available, any comment on that project?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2825754][color=#98FB98][b]CyberGuard:[/b][/color][/url] Could, but it's still in the works and honestly I only need more processing power to make it work. If I had like a  10k unit server I could do a million times more than what I have now.
But smash the question in there and let me formulate an answer.  Up to this point is has been a project created, hosted and maintained by me and another member from NullPatrol (a little private group). But we have a few big plans on expanding with unit servers.
Currently our biggest limitation is processing power to encrypt plains. We currently have access to 1,060,000,000+ hashes with two databases making it already one of the largest hash databases in the world with one of the most types of hashes, both salted and normal. Not to mention that we are in the progress of adding salted hashes from leaked (private and public) databases like xsplit and NGU. [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4961877][b]See Here[/b][/url]

Quite exciting stuff, I will look forward to the finished product.
To dabble off slightly, you have also been working closelywith True Demon towards a professional service which closely incorporates true Hacking Ethics.  What are your thoughts on Ethical Hacking, and why is it a need in today's modern technological society?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2825754][color=#98FB98][b]CyberGuard:[/b][/color][/url] Almost a rhetorical question if you ask me. I mean, what kind of company or service wants to wake up to an email or even news paper article of someone leaking all their user's data or private company information.  I think that every company should have at least one or two security experts accessible at all times as well as have a professional company perform a full penetration test for their entire system. This way they can be sure that their data is safe against almost all (non 0-day) attacks. The security experts ensure that new patches are installed and security guidelines are enforced as much as possible. 
True Demon, I and a few others from that service strive towards helping both small and large companies with this by providing full on security penetration tests. This is basically the same as having a hostile hacker try and smash your door in. Except this hacker enforces the door with steel after he's done and makes sure the windows are all closed to prevent other, not so friendly people from barging in.  If any of the websites or services on HF are interested in a penetration testing service, they can just send me or True Demon a PM and we'll try and help you out.
I'm sure that none of you would like to have any of your stuff exposed to the public (yes, I'm looking at you booters and stressers. Hosting companies and file sharing services)

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada:[/b][/color][/url] So to you, Ethical Hacking is not so much "Doing the right thing" or not being malicious with the skillset, but to apply it towards the end goal of security?
It would appear multiple fortune 500 companies agree, and in recent years have gone out of their way to recruit known hackers.  How do you think this newly adopted practice will impact the IT security industry in the long run?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2825754][color=#98FB98][b]CyberGuard:[/b][/color][/url] Well, when people speak of hacking, it's always about that malicious Russian guy that tries to watch you undress in front of your webcam. But people still don't realize that hacking is also the developing of new things (hackathon) and the prevention of that malicious Russian guy getting in your pc (ethical hacking). 
In the long run I believe that many companies that recruit hackers have the advantage over companies that recruit just 'security experts' or don't recruit at all.
One of the fundamental differences between those two is that security experts don't try to smash your door in, while we as "ethical hackers" try to impersonate the Russian guy and look for holes in your system.  Sometimes to find the solution to a problem you must look at it from a different angle.
Back to answer your question though: I believe that companies the recruit hackers will have an exponentially better security than other companies. Even a single full (offensive) pentest for a few thousand dollars could make you more secure than big companies that invest millions into their "security experts" that only install patches for their systems.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada:[/b][/color][/url] A very intriguing view, I can say, I can only agree.  Apple hired the one guy who kept jail breaking the iPhone and in turn has made it a whole lot harder, if even possible anymore.  Would be interesting to see a discussion thread about this topic.
But were out of time, before we go, I have one last question.
If you could change or improve on anything on Hack Forums, what would it be?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2825754][color=#98FB98][b]CyberGuard:[/b][/color][/url] An official stickied FAQ that people could in some way contribute to for the beginner hacking section could really be helpful, this way we wouldn't have to answer the same question every day. Even a small thing like a question "how to rat" and then a link to the ratting section could clean up the section a lot.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada:[/b][/color][/url] Agreed it would be helpful, maybe a consideration for Omni in the future.
That pretty much wraps it up, anything further to say before we go?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2825754][color=#98FB98][b]CyberGuard:[/b][/color][/url] Keep learning and feel free to join the Hash Cracking Enthusiast group if you have any interest in cryptography or hash cracking, we're ready to help you out as much as we can :D

Curiosity is KEY to success

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566][color=#FFFFFF][b]Armada:[/b][/color][/url] Good words to live by.
Well, thank you for your time and hope to see you posting on the forums!
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2825754][color=#98FB98][b]CyberGuard:[/b][/color][/url] Thanks and the same to you!
[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[color=transparent]       [/color][/size][/font]

[b][color=white]New Color Scheme[/color][/b]
Thanks to your feedbacks, we are now trying out a new color scheme. This time we're going for a semi-dull approach to avoid having distracting headers. Do you guys prefer the bright color scheme or the semi-dull color scheme?

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://hackforums.news/assets/exp/281/WorldNews.png[/img][/align]

[url=http://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-35673533][b][color=white]Al-Shabab Attack Somali Hotel[/color][/b][/url]
Al-Shabab militants attacked a hotel in the Somali capital Mogadishu on Friday. At least nine people were killed in the attack. Al-Shabab in an insurgent group in Somalia with ties to al-Qaeda. It is common for the group to launch attacks in the capital on Friday, which is the first day in the Somali weekend. Only one day before the group launched mortars on the nearby presidential palace, killing three people. The militant used a car bomb outside the Somali Youth League hotel. Another explosion happened at a park known as the Peace Garden. Four militants were killed by police who subdued the attack.

[url=http://www.nytimes.com/2016/02/27/world/asia/nepal-plane-crash.html?ref=world&_r=0][b][color=white]Two People Die in Nepal Plane Crash[/color][/b][/url]
Nepalese police and helicopters responded to the scene of a plane crash in the district of Kalikot. Both the pilot and co-pilot were killed, and the nine passengers were injured. Reports say that the plane attempted to make an emergency landing in the rural mountainous area, due to technical problems with the plane. The flight left Jumla and was supposed to travel to Nepalganj. The crash comes only days after another plane crash killed 23 people in northwest of Kathmandu, due to harsh weather conditions. Nepal has a notoriously bad flight safety record, and restrictions have been placed on Nepal-based flights by the European Union. 

[url=http://www.reuters.com/article/india-labour-crime-idUSKCN0VY0BU][b][color=white]Indian Teen Escapes Torturous Debt Bondage[/color][/b][/url]
15 year old Marimuthu was forced to work at a sweet shop in Pundarpur India, as a part of a debt bondage deal his mother made. His mother needed to repay a debt of approximately $290, and sent her son to work at the shop for one year for a total of $580. The boy describes harsh conditions, where he worked from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day, in cramped spaces, under constant verbal abuse by his employer. Marimuthu had a bad headache one day, and needed to sit down to rest for a moment. That's when the shop owner verbally attacked him, and threw a pan of hot oil across his legs. The boy took the $3 he had saved and ran away, taking trains for two days to get home. Authorities are not confident about getting justice for the incident, due to jurisdiction issues. The Global Slavery Index estimates that nearly 16 million people have been forced into similar debt bondage or other similar situations in India.

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/exp/281/TechNews.png[/img][/align]

[color=white][url=https://blog.popcorntime.sh/official-statement/][b]Popcorn Time is Officially Back[/b][/url][/color]
Earlier this week, part of the team apparently behind popcorntime.io announced a comeback, four months after being shut down and hit with a lawsuit from the Motion Picture Association of America (MPAA). Like its predecessor, the new service offers sleek streaming-video apps that play a large selection of pirated movies, all distributed via BitTorrent. The developers stated in a blog post that "after the 'MPAA incident,' we're a little diminished, and we've chosen a new direction: we're shifting from an active development of Popcorn Time to a more or less resilience-driven development."

[color=white][url=http://www.reuters.com/article/us-apple-samsung-elec-appeal-idUSKCN0VZ24I][b]Samsung Wins Appeal in $120M Patent Dispute With Apple[/b][/url][/color]
Samsung scored perhaps their biggest legal win over Apple in their long-running patent war. On Feb. 26, a federal appeals court overturned a 2014 verdict that slapped the tech giant with nearly $120 million in damages. As Reuters reports, the three-judge appeals court unanimously disagreed with the lower court's findings against Samsung. Two Apple patents, including one for its slide-to-unlock feature, are invalid and a third was not infringed, the court ruled. The decision not only ensures Samsung does not have to write another check to Apple; it also can continue using the smartphone features and will not have to make any changes to older models.

[color=white][url=https://blogs.windows.com/buildingapps/2016/02/25/an-update-on-the-developer-opportunity-and-windows-10/][b]Microsoft Officially Ends Project Astoria[/b][/url][/color]
After months of speculation, Microsoft has officially closed down "Project Astoria" – a software tool first announced in 2015 to help developers bring their Android apps to Windows 10 phones, tablets, and PCs. Project Astoria was just one of four software bridges from other platforms that Microsoft announced last year to try and grow its library of Universal Windows Platform apps. The other three were Project Islandwood for Objective-C iOS apps, Project Centennial for existing Win32 and .NET apps, and The Web Bridge for HTML and JavaScript web apps. Microsoft says it's still proceeding with those three projects.

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/exp/281/GamingNews.png[/img][/align]

[url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2016/02/18/dice-2016-kojima-still-hopes-to-work-with-norman-reedus][b][color=white]Norman Reedus, and Hideo Kojima Reunion[/color][/b][/url]
Hideo Kojima posted a photo on his twitter account this week with Norman Reedus by his side which enthralled countless fans of the Silent Hill franchise. After a dispute between Konami and Kojima, Silent Hills was cancelled indefinitely. However, Hideo Kojima, Norman Reedus, and Guillermo del Toro have all released statements recently exclaiming that they would all love to work together in the near future. Kojima is eager to expand the popularity of his recently independent production studio, Kojima Productions. New games have been reported to already be in development. Silent Hills might live on under a different name and restore hope for fans of horror genre gaming. 

[url=http://www.forbes.com/sites/erikkain/2016/02/18/the-5-biggest-problems-with-street-fighter-v/][b][color=white]Street Fighter Disappoints [/color][/b][/url]
The highly anticipated Street Fighter 5 hit stores February 16, but was met with harsh criticism from critics and long time fans of the series. It is not all bad though. The graphics received an extensive overhaul, missed characters returned, and the gameplay is extremely fun and innovative. However, Capcom's latest entry into the Street Fighter franchise feels incomplete and hollow due to its lack of features and small cast. Street Fighter 5 lacks an arcade mode and has just 16 characters upon its release. Street Fighter 5 has future content including 6 new characters planned, but as of now it does not feel worthy of a purchase. As it stands, Street Fighter 5 is a work in progress with boundless potential. Capcom should have held off on a premature release and delivered a finished product. 

[url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/square-enix-invites-miss-universe-to-final-fantasy/1100-6434950/][b][color=white]Miss Universe Invited to Final Fantasy 15 Release Date Event[/color][/b][/url]
Final Fantasy 15 has been in development for about 10 years and the news everyone has been waiting for is nearly here. Square Enix will be holding a release date announcement event on March 30. Longtime Final Fantasy fan and Miss Universe title holder, Pia Wurtzbach, will be in attendance. Square Enix reached out to Wurtzbach this week and her response was nothing short of ecstatic. The news that fans of Final Fantasy have been waiting for is nearly here and Miss Universe will be one of the first to hear it. Final Fantasy 15 is expected to hit shelves sometime this year.

[color=transparent]       [/color][/size][/font]

[font=Trebuchet MS][size=1][color=transparent]       [/color]

If there are no submissions for that week, I will grab two battlestations from /r/battlestations.[/align]

[list][*][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2214473].Sinister[/url][color=#98FB98]*[/color], [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=952566]Armada[/url], [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=525019]illuminati[/url], [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1957866]Enterpriser[/url], [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878]Clique[/url][/list][/list]

[list][*][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=525019]illuminati▲[/url] & [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2577525]Hash G.[/url][/list][/list]
[list][*]Hacking News
[list][*][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=610356]Wires[/url] & [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1422600]Fox™[/url][/list][/list]
[list][*]Security News
[list][*][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1696750]Harbo5[/url][/list][/list]
[list][*]Gaming News
[list][*][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2384610]Limit.[/url] & [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2364291]Buffy Summers[/url][/list][/list]
[list][*]Tech News
[list][*][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1356937]Аngel[/url] & [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1730460]Gladly[/url][/list][/list]
[list][*]World News
